DOC.brief_summary: Dry Eye Syndrome ( DES ) common condition affect approximately 20 % adult age 45 old . Although several clinical test diagnosis monitor DES available , currently gold standard assessment DES exist . It , however , hypothesize assessment tear film osmolarity may new promise approach objective non-invasive method diagnosis monitoring treatment success . Recently , new commercially available instrument ( TearLab® , OcuSens Inc , San Diego , USA ) assessment tear film osmolarity introduce . This instrument allow easy non-invasive determination tear film osmolarity . Unfortunately , data reproducibility yet available . Consequently , current study set investigate short time reproducibility tear film osmolarity measurement use TearLab® instrument .
DOC.brief_title: Reproducibility Tearfilm Osmolarity Measurements Using TearLab® Patients With Dry Eye Syndrome Healthy Subjects
